content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Initializing an empty string to append the extracted julia code blocks
    output = ""

    # Regular expression pattern to match code fences with Julia language identifier
    pattern = r"`{3}(\w+)\n?([\s\S]*?)\n?`{3}"

    # Regex match all instances of the pattern in the markdown string
    matches = eachmatch(pattern, md)

    # Iterate over matches and append the content after removing the code fences
    for match in matches
        if match.captures[1] == "julia"
            # Get the content inside the code block without the fences
            content = replace(String(match.captures[2]), "\n" => " ")
            output *= (strip(content) * "\n")
        end
    end

    return output
end
```

This function `extract_julia_code` takes a string `md` containing markdown content with Julia code blocks and returns the extracted Julia code as a string without any formatting.
